docs.lead_paragraph: Legislation permanently overhauling how Medicare pays physicians won approval Tuesday from an atypically united Congress as lawmakers banded together to erase an irritant that has dogged them for years.

headline.main: Congress OKs Bipartisan Bill Changing Doctors' Medicare Fees
headline.print_headline: Congress OKs Bipartisan Bill Changing Doctors' Medicare Fees

docs.snippet: Legislation permanently overhauling how Medicare pays physicians won approval Tuesday from an atypically united Congress as lawmakers banded together to erase an irritant that has dogged them for years.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court has rejected Wisconsin Sen. Ron Johnson's effort to stop members of Congress and their staffs from getting health insurance subsidies under President Barack Obama's 2010 healthcare law.

headline.main: Wisconsin Senator Loses Appeal of Obamacare Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Wisconsin Senator Loses Appeal of Obamacare Lawsuit

docs.snippet: A federal appeals court has rejected Wisconsin Sen. Ron Johnson's effort to stop members of Congress and their staffs from getting health insurance subsidies under President Barack Obama's 2010 healthcare law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congress on Tuesday approved a bill to repair the formula for reimbursing Medicare physicians, marking a rare bipartisan achievement just in time to head off a 21 percent cut in the doctors' pay.

headline.main: Congress Approves Formula Fixing Medicare Doctors Pay
headline.print_headline: Congress Approves Formula Fixing Medicare Doctors Pay

docs.snippet: Congress on Tuesday approved a bill to repair the formula for reimbursing Medicare physicians, marking a rare bipartisan achievement just in time to head off a 21 percent cut in the doctors' pay.

docs.lead_paragraph: Your private medical information is under threat. That's according to a study that found almost 30 million health records nationwide were involved in criminal theft, malicious hacking or other data breaches over four years. The incidents seem to be increasing.

headline.main: Patients' Medical Records Under Threat From Data Breaches
headline.print_headline: Patients' Medical Records Under Threat From Data Breaches

docs.abstract: What are the most useless, unfair or counterproductive personal tax breaks?
docs.snippet: What are the most useless, unfair or counterproductive personal tax breaks?

docs.lead_paragraph: Labor union officials say they could postpone a vote seeking to organize 3,000 workers at Boeing Co's factory here in South Carolina if their campaign fails to gain enough traction against fierce opposition from the company and local politicians.

headline.main: Union Might Postpone Vote Seeking to Organize Boeing's South Carolina Plant
headline.print_headline: Union Might Postpone Vote Seeking to Organize Boeing's South Carolina Plant

docs.snippet: Labor union officials say they could postpone a vote seeking to organize 3,000 workers at Boeing Co's factory here in South Carolina if their campaign fails to gain enough traction against fierce opposition from the company and local politicians.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. spending on prescription drugs soared last year, driven up primarily by costly breakthrough medicines, manufacturer price hikes and a surge from millions of people newly insured due to the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: IMS: US Prescription Drug Spending Jumped 13 Pct. In 2014
headline.print_headline: IMS: US Prescription Drug Spending Jumped 13 Pct. In 2014

docs.snippet: U.S. spending on prescription drugs soared last year, driven up primarily by costly breakthrough medicines, manufacturer price hikes and a surge from millions of people newly insured due to the Affordable Care Act.

docs.lead_paragraph: The health care sector has become the hot target for hackers in recent months, according to researchers at Symantec, a leading cybersecurity company that says it's also seeing big increases in "spear-phishing," ''ransomware" and efforts to exploit newly discovered vulnerabilities in software used by a wide range of industries.

headline.main: Hackers Keep Trying New Targets in Search of Easy Data
headline.print_headline: Hackers Keep Trying New Targets in Search of Easy Data

docs.lead_paragraph: In the IMS study, patients with Medicaid in states that expanded access to the program filled 25.4 percent more prescriptions than in the previous year.

headline.main: Study Finds Broad Rise in Medication Use by Those Newly Joining Medicaid
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Broad Rise in Medication Use by Those Newly Joining Medicaid

docs.abstract: IMS Institute for Healthcare Informatics reports new patients with Medicaid in states that increased access to program filled 25.4 percent more prescriptions in 2014 than in 2013.
docs.snippet: In the IMS study, patients with Medicaid in states that expanded access to the program filled 25.4 percent more prescriptions than in the previous year.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the Republicans’ 100th day in control of Congress approached, Mitch McConnell, the Senate majority leader, said the chamber’s productivity had become better than it had been in years.

headline.main: From Cybersecurity to Trade Deal, Bills Are Expected to Start Moving
headline.print_headline: From Cybersecurity to Trade Deal, Bills Are Expected to Start Moving

docs.abstract: Congressional Memo; Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, after slow start by Republicans in their control of Congress, says Senate is becoming more productive than it has been in years; his challenge will be to sustain momentum while working with slender majority and hostile Democrats.
docs.snippet: As the Republicans’ 100th day in control of Congress approached, Mitch McConnell, the Senate majority leader, said the chamber’s productivity had become better than it had been in years.
